item.title: 销售增长担忧加剧，Abercrombie 511% 的涨势降温
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch Co.股价大涨的势头正在减弱，因为华尔街担心该零售商能否继续实现强劲的销售增长，以证明其高昂的估值是合理的。【原文：A blistering rally in Abercrombie & Fitch Co. shares is losing steam as Wall Street frets over the retailer’s ability to keep delivering strong sales growth to justify its high valuation.】

item.title: 公共部门招聘推动加拿大劳动力市场发展
item.description: 上个月，公共部门就业人数的增长超过了加拿大企业就业人数的减少，这凸显出劳动力市场受到了政府招聘的支撑。【原文：Employment gains in the public sector more than offset losses among Canadian businesses last month, highlighting a labor market that has been propped up by government hiring.】

item.title: EQT 希望长期持有私募股权投资获胜者
item.description: EQT AB 对欧洲资本市场的现状感到非常沮丧，因此正在探索建立一种结构，使其能够更长期地持有某些资产。【原文：EQT AB is so frustrated with the state of capital markets in Europe that it’s exploring the creation of structures that would allow it to hold certain assets for longer.】

item.title: 光速聘请埃利奥特的 Isaac Kim 推动技术收购
item.description: 据知情人士透露，光速创投（Lightspeed Venture Partners）聘请了埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）的艾萨克-金（Isaac Kim），因为这家风险投资公司计划进军以技术为重点的杠杆收购领域。【原文：Lightspeed Venture Partners hired Elliott Investment Management’s Isaac Kim as the venture capital firm plans a foray into technology-focused leveraged buyouts, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 能量饮料生产商 Celsius 创纪录的业绩刺激了卖空者
item.description: 在能量饮料制造商 Celsius Holdings Inc. 在过去四个交易日中有三个交易日创下收盘新高后，对该公司下看跌赌注的投资者正在舔舐伤口。【原文：Investors making bearish wagers against Celsius Holdings Inc. are licking their wounds after the energy-drink maker set record closing highs in three of the past four sessions.】

item.title: 美联储和欧洲央行步调一致，欧元将迎来今年最佳一周
item.description: 由于美国经济疲软的暗示助长了美联储和欧洲央行将在同一时间转向降息的赌注，欧元兑美元的汇率创下了今年以来最好的一周。【原文：The euro is having its best week of the year against the dollar as hints of weakness in the US economy fuel bets the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank will pivot to interest-rate cuts at around the same time.】

item.title: 身家 19 亿美元的房地产投资者在 "定价错误 "的市场中游荡
item.description: 私募股权公司高管罗布-库默（Rob Kumer）认为，全球金融市场正努力应对商业地产的动荡，这正是一个买入机会。【原文：Private equity executive Rob Kumer sees a buying opportunity as global financial markets grapple with the turmoil in commercial real estate.】

item.title: Memecoins 和以太币在破纪录的一周里超过了比特币
item.description: 在比特币创下历史新高后，加密货币交易者似乎已经开始将注意力转移到其他地方，以获得更高的回报。【原文：Crypto traders already appear to be shifting their attention elsewhere for higher returns after Bitcoin reached an all-time high.】

item.title: 瑞士政府表示，瑞士与欧盟的谈判可能将于三月启动
item.description: 重塑瑞士与欧盟关系的会谈可能将于本月开始。【原文：Talks to revamp relations between Switzerland and the European Union will likely start this month.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司股息引发震荡，巴西市场成为全球最差市场
item.description: 在国家控制的石油生产商巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）支付了低于预期的股息后，投资者对巴西资产产生了疑虑，这再次引发了对拉美国家政治风险的担忧。【原文：Investors soured on Brazilian assets after state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA paid a lower-than-expected dividend, rekindling fears of political risk in the Latin American country.】

item.title: 数十亿资金涌入尼日利亚，蒂努布的改革初见成效
item.description: 随着博拉-蒂努布总统政府推行的改革初见成效，外国投资者对尼日利亚资产和海外公民汇回国内的资金的需求在上个月激增。【原文：Foreign investor demand for Nigerian assets and money sent home by citizens living abroad surged last month as reforms instituted by President Bola Tinubu’s administration started paying off.】

item.title: 美国就业数据公布后，黄金延续创纪录涨势，2,200 美元指日可待
item.description: 在一份关键的美国就业报告增强了美联储将很快降息的预期之后，黄金延续涨势，创下历史新高。【原文：Gold extended its rally to a fresh record high after a key US jobs report bolstered expectations that the Federal Reserve will soon cut interest rates.】

item.title: 美国就业人数超预期，达 27.5 万人，但工资增长放缓
item.description: 美国 2 月份就业人数超过预期，而工资涨幅有所放缓，这进一步表明经济增长健康，通胀走软。【原文：US employment surpassed expectations in February while wage gains moderated, adding to signs of healthy economic growth and softer inflation.】

item.title: 加拿大新增就业人数比预期多一倍，工资增长率降至 4.9
item.description: 加拿大的劳动力市场超出预期，就业岗位增幅为 9 月份以来最大，但失业率上升和工资增长放缓仍表明未来通胀压力将有所缓解。【原文：Canada’s labor market blew past expectations with the biggest job gains since September, but a rising unemployment rate and slowing wage growth still point to easing inflation pressures ahead.】

item.title: 电动汽车动荡加剧，特斯拉的华尔街拥趸变得焦躁不安
item.description: 自 2021 年 4 月以来，建议投资者购买特斯拉公司股票的分析师比例最低。【原文：Tesla Inc.’s support among Wall Street bulls is weakening with the lowest percentage of analysts since April 2021 recommending that investors buy the stock.】

item.title: 纽约风格的魅力将提振欧洲的 IPO 日子
item.description: 欧洲的证券交易所要想在上市方面与纽约竞争，就必须把首次公开募股的启动仪式变成一场华丽的盛宴。【原文：Europe’s stock exchanges need to turn launches for initial public offerings into a glitzy day out if they want to compete with New York for listings.】

item.title: 前罗尔斯-罗伊斯公司经理在与董事会发生争执后辞去德国公用事业公司职务
item.description: 安德烈亚斯-谢尔（Andreas Schell）在德国巴登一符腾堡州能源公司（Energie Baden-Wuerttemberg AG）的三年任期还未过半时，就因战略问题与监事会发生冲突，出人意料地辞去了该公司首席执行官的职务。【原文：Andreas Schell unexpectedly resigned as chief executive of German utility Energie Baden-Wuerttemberg AG less than halfway into his three-year term after clashing with the supervisory board over strategy.】

item.title: Vanguard 基金经理加码押注日本加息概率高的债券
item.description: 先锋资产管理有限公司（Vanguard Asset Management Ltd. ）基金经理阿莱克斯-库特尼（Ales Koutny）深信，日本央行即将在几周内加息，因此他正在最大限度地加大对亚洲国家政府债券的押注。【原文：Vanguard Asset Management Ltd. fund manager Ales Koutny is so convinced that the Bank of Japan is on the brink of hiking interest rates within weeks that he’s ramping up a bet against the Asian nation’s government bonds to the maximum.】

item.title: 中国冶炼企业面临考验，铜价跌至接近零的水平
item.description: 在进口矿石加工费骤降至个位数后，中国铜冶炼厂正处于紧要关头，它们是否会继续抵制减产压力成为人们关注的焦点。【原文：China’s copper smelters are at a critical juncture after fees for processing imported ore collapsed to single figures, raising focus on whether they will keep resisting pressure for production cuts.】

item.title: KKR 旗下荷兰自行车制造商的麻烦促使贷款人寻求建议
item.description: 据知情人士透露，KKR & Co.控制的雅克集团（Accell Group NV）的贷款人已经选择了顾问，帮助他们评估这家荷兰自行车制造商的选择方案。【原文：Lenders to KKR & Co.-controlled Accell Group NV have chosen advisers to help them assess options for the Dutch bikemaker which is burning through cash amid sluggish demand and operational challenges, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德、飞行出租车以及 ARK 与灰熊的再次较量
item.description: 上一次，Cathie Wood 和 ARK 投资管理公司与 Grizzly Research 的判断背道而驰，损失了数千万美元。但这并不妨碍他们再次面对激进的做空者。【原文：The last time Cathie Wood and ARK Investment Management found themselves on the opposite side of a call made by Grizzly Research, they lost tens of millions of dollars. It’s not stopping them from facing down the activist short seller once again.】

item.title: 合并谈判仍在继续，阿联酋化学品制造商仍在寻求扩张
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国最大的化学品生产商 Borouge Plc 正在寻求进一步扩张的机会，同时它也在寻求与奥地利 OMV AG 旗下的一家公司进行价值 300 亿欧元（328 亿美元）的合作。【原文：The United Arab Emirates’s biggest chemicals producer Borouge Plc is seeking further expansion opportunities, even as it pursues a €30 billion ($32.8 billion) tie-up with a unit of Austria’s OMV AG.】

item.title: 枪手绑架尼日利亚数百名小学生
item.description: 武装分子从尼日利亚北部一所小学绑架了数百名儿童，给这个正在应对生活费用危机的西非国家带来了新的安全挑战。【原文：Armed men abducted hundreds of children from an elementary school in northern Nigeria, triggering a new security challenge in the West African nation that is dealing with a cost-of-living crisis.】

item.title: 债券市场期待就业数据验证降息预期
item.description: 过去几周，债券交易员们加大了对美联储今年降息的押注，他们面临的风险越来越大。【原文：Risks are building for bond traders who’ve spent the last couple of weeks adding to bets on Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.】
